entries.text: Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Imagination produces fragmented knowledge derived from sensory experience.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Imaginative cognition relies on associative memory rather than causal clarity.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Superstition arises from imaginative misinterpretation of natural events.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Political manipulation exploits collective imagination.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Fear strengthens imaginative distortion of reality.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Images persist in the mind independent of rational correction.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Inadequate ideas originate from partial imaginative perception.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Narrative myth stabilizes social imagination but obscures causal necessity.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Passions intensify when governed by imagination alone.
Within Spinoza’s epistemology of imagination, Common opinion reflects shared imaginative constructs.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason grasps common notions shared across modes of substance.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Rational knowledge identifies causal chains underlying phenomena.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Through reason, individuals transform passive affects into active ones.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason aligns self-preservation with cooperative political order.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Adequate ideas emerge through rational comprehension of necessity.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Freedom begins when action follows from rational understanding.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason dissolves anthropomorphic projections onto nature.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Rational ethics equates virtue with increased power of acting.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason recognizes that all beings express the same substance.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Political tolerance arises from rational awareness of shared nature.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason moderates destructive passions.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Understanding necessity reduces resentment.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Rational community maximizes collective conatus.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Reason exposes teleological illusions.
In Spinoza’s second epistemic level of reason, Ethical clarity depends on rational distinction between adequate and inadequate ideas.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuitive knowledge grasps singular essences through direct intellectual insight.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuition perceives the unity of substance beyond conceptual mediation.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, The intellectual love of God culminates in intuitive understanding.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuition transcends discursive reasoning while preserving necessity.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Through intuition, eternity is understood as timeless being.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuitive cognition dissolves fear of death.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuition integrates finite modes within infinite substance.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Joy reaches its highest form in intuitive knowledge.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Intuitive awareness recognizes all events as expressions of necessity.
At Spinoza’s highest epistemic level of intuition, Blessedness coincides with intuitive participation in Nature.
Spinoza maintains that Substance is self-caused and infinite.
Spinoza maintains that Attributes express the essence of substance.
Spinoza maintains that Modes depend ontologically upon substance.
Spinoza maintains that Conatus defines each being’s striving.
Spinoza maintains that Determinism structures natural and human action.
Spinoza maintains that Parallelism replaces mind–body interaction.
Spinoza maintains that Freedom equals understanding necessity.
Spinoza maintains that The state secures rational coexistence.
Spinoza maintains that Democracy reflects collective rational power.
Spinoza maintains that Scripture requires historical interpretation.
Spinoza maintains that Miracles are misunderstood natural events.
Spinoza maintains that Power (potentia) underlies political authority.
Spinoza maintains that Superstition destabilizes political order.
Spinoza maintains that Joy increases power of acting.
Spinoza maintains that Sadness diminishes vitality.
Spinoza maintains that Virtue equals rational strength.
Spinoza maintains that Immanence replaces transcendence.
Spinoza maintains that Ethics unfolds geometrically from ontology.
Spinoza maintains that Knowledge progresses through structured levels.
Spinoza maintains that Understanding transforms passive affect into active agency.
